results.title: Picture books on video. - Volume 2 = Turramulli and the giant Quinkin
results.creator_credit: Video Classroom, Catharine Campbell and Cathy Miller
results.brief_description: Three Aboriginal Dreamtime stories. “Turramulli the giant Quinkin” and “Banana Bird and the Snake men” are both written by Percy Trezise, illustrated by Dick Roughsey and narrated by Bob Maza. “The Frog and the pelican” is written by Des O’Brien. The stories are narrated with background music as the illustrations are shown on screen.

results.title: Picture books on video. - Volume 1 = A pet for Mrs Arbuckle
results.creator_credit: Video Classroom, Cathy Miller and Catharine Campbell
results.brief_description: The award winning, Australian Children’s stories on this video include: “A Pet for Mrs Arbuckle” by Gwenda Smyth with illustrations by Ann James and narration by Joan Bruce. “Barnaby and the Rocket” by Lydia Cowell and narration by Penne Hackforth Jones. “Whistle Up the Chimney” by Nan Hunt with illustrations by Craig Smith and narration by Pamela Lloyd.

results.title: Pictorial sketching
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Engineering Drawing”.
Animated drawings and live photography are used in explaining the basic principles of pictorial sketching. Describes the three methods of pictorial sketching, and explains where and how to use each method. Demonstrates a step-by-step procedure for sketching, from the initial visualisation to the checking of the completed sketch.

results.title: Pictorial Parade No. 25. No random harvest
results.brief_description: New Zealand’s pine plantations, among the largest man-made forests in the world, are now producing the raw materials for timber and paper manufacture. New saw and paper mills have been built and existing plants enlarged. New railways and towns were also needed to service the industries created by this planned harvest of timber.

results.title: Picnic with Weismann = Picknick mit Weismann
results.creator_credit: A H Puluj, ACI Films and Jan Svankmajer
results.brief_description: An unusual, surrealistic recounting of a day’s outing. Inanimate objects (a man’s suit, a trowel, charis, an old gramophone) take on a life of their own. A wardrobe opens and a man, bound and gagged falls into a prepared grave.

results.title: Picnic at Hanging Rock (Director's cut) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: McElroy & McElroy, Hal McElroy, Jim McElroy, Patricia Lovell and Peter Weir
results.brief_description: In the summer of 1900 three girls from a private school and their teacher unaccountably vanish on a St Valentine’s Day school picnic to a mysterious rock in the midst of the Australian bush. The Victorian girls’ school for the daughters of the privileged gradually becomes contaminated and destroyed from within by its inability to understand the forces confronting it. Based on a novel which mythologises the emergence of sexuality, the film atmospherically follows various tangents without distilling a sense of explanation. Unease is evoked by the horror of not knowing. Based on the novel by Joan Lindsay. Cast includes Rachel Roberts, Dominic Guard, Helen Morse and Jacki Weaver. This special 25th anniversary edition is a widescreen, restored director’s cut version containing 7 minutes less footage than original version.

results.title: Picnic
results.creator_credit: Fred Kohlmar, Columbia Pictures and Joshua Logan
results.brief_description: Based on William Inge’s Pulitzer Prize winning Broadway hit, “Picnic” is a revealing look into the hearts and minds of a select group of Kansas townfolk over Labor Day weekend. This simple yet poignant story stars William Holden as an itinerant drifter who swings into town, stirring up trouble and awakening the interest of Kim Novak. At first, Holden refused the role - considering himself too old for the part at 37. However, his outstanding performance proved critical to the film’s success, and his love scenes with Novak are considered to be among the most sensual in cinema history. Co-starring Susan Strasberg, Rosalind Russell and Cliff Robertson, “Picnic” was nominated for several and also won two Academy Awards.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Fred Kohlmar, Columbia Pictures and Joshua Logan

results.title: Pickup on South Street = Pick up on South Street
results.creator_credit: Jules Schermer, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Samuel Fuller
results.brief_description: Iconic film noir set in New York about a pickpocket who lifts microfilm bearing US secrets from the handbag of the former mistress of a Communist spy. Sam Fuller combines brisk pacing with sizzling dialogue to create a masterful political thriller that plays upon the over-ripe fears of Communism, espionage and political conspiracy. Richard Windmark plays a wonderfully amoral Skip McCoy, a freshly sprung jailbird, trying to play for all best angles, in an increasingly dangerous game he barely comprehends. Also stars the peerless Thelma Ritter as a street-wise grifter and Jean Peters as the louche femme fatale.
